DataElement.preferredName: Have Hospitalized or Treated for Heart Failure Past 21 Days Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indicator that specifies if the participant have hospitalized with heart failure in the last 21 days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Have Hospitalized or Treated for Heart Failure Past 21 Days
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Used to describe the possession, relationships, or the state of something or someone._A question about whether an individual has been hospitalized or treated for heart failure.:Before the present time._A natural number greater than twenty and less than twenty-two and the quantity that it denotes._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Heart Failure: Over the last 21 days, have you been hospitalized for any symptoms of heart failure (severe chest pain, shortness of breath, leg swelling)?
